_comment: Improved JSON structure for better data organization and machine-readability.

history.summary: A World War I fighter squadron of the Luftstreitkräfte, credited with 155 aerial victories. As one of the original German fighter squadrons, it was a seasoned unit by the time it joined Jagdgeschwader II in 1918.

formation.context: Created from an existing ad hoc unit, Fokkerstaffel West, in support of the 7th Armee.

notableEvents.event: Scored the squadron's first aerial victory.
During 'Bloody April', the squadron downed 23 Royal Flying Corps aircraft.
Joined Jagdgeschwader II, alongside Jasta 13, Jasta 15, and Jasta 19.
Temporarily grounded due to a lack of serviceable aircraft.

commanders.name: Adolf von Tutschek
commanders.note: Notable ace, wounded and relieved of command.

notablePilots.name: Adolf Schulte
notablePilots.note: The squadron's first ace, achieving the status on 24 March 1917.

notablePilots.name: Ulrich Neckel
notablePilots.note: Winner of the Pour le Mérite and Iron Cross.

notablePilots.name: Paul Billik
notablePilots.note: Iron Cross and Hohenzollern winner; highest scoring ace to be denied a Pour le Mérite.

markings.description: Common squadron paint scheme was black tails and rear fuselages with white propeller spinners and/or engine cowlings.

source.comment: Original source path was an absolute path, changed to a relative one for portability.
